alert.note: Alert for Knox; McCreary; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 4:18PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Knox, central McCreary and central Whitley Counties through 445 PM EST... At 418 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Duckrun, or near Whitley City, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bounty around 425 PM EST. Redbird, Krupp, Goldbug, Clio, Bon, Emlyn and Youngs Creek around 430 PM EST. Williamsburg, Wofford, Rockholds, Suttons Mill, Walden, Yaden, Julip, Lucky, Faber and Verne around 435 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Perkins, Louden, Wilton, Woodbine, Permon, Swan Lake, Dishman Springs, Clate, Indian Creek, King, Swanpond, Bryants Store, Gausdale and Emmanuel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
